item.title: RMS skip on highway with NO lights….., 25th September
item.description:
Please instruct RMS to fix lights to ALL their skips they place on OUR highways….. Photo attached taken c.6am Wednesday 24 September…… Still UNLIT today Thursday 25 September….. Why are RMS ‘allowed’ to get away with this? I had to take this up with the previous director….do I need to take it up with the new one? Please advise……

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lower Camden, Elmstead, London

item.title: Resident of Hugh Gaitskell House throwing cat/dog waste out of the window on the pavement below., 25th September
item.description:
I was walking west on Manor Road this morning When a resident of Hugh Gaitskell house, opening the window and threw cat or dog waste (faeces) out onto the pavement below. It was only chance that nobody was hit. This has happened numerous times before.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stamford Hill, Hackney, London

item.description:

item.title: Only 10 seconds on green, 25th September
item.description:
Bad timing on lights here on traffic going North on Kentish Way ( and possibly South) whereby there are long tailbacks at busy times as there is only about 10 seconds for a green light before they go back to red. Absolutely absurd.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Widmore Road, Plaistow, London

item.title: Dead cat on dual carriage way, heading towards the horse roundabout, 25th September
item.description:
Sadly there is a deceased cat that has been run over, on the dual carriageway, heading towards the horse roundabout. Location approximate
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excessive tree creaking in wind., 25th September
item.description:
The crab apple tree on the pavement outside my property has been excessively creaking with the recent winds. A few times we have had to move the cars from the drive as we have been very concerned that a branch or possibly the tree may fall on to one of them. Although we can not see any damaged branches I will be most grateful if it can be checked. In addition to this the fruit has fallen excessively in the past 1 to 2 weeks & I have had to clear the payment several times as it has become a danger to pedestrians. Last week a man slipped & fell on them whilst walking their dog. My young nephew fell the following day although I had cleared them the day before. At the weekend my 83 year old father slipped on some fruit as the evening light did not show the fruit. Fortunately my husband was walking next to him & was able to prevent him falling but he did have a saw back from moving so quickly. This is an accident that he can not afford to have again following a broken bone in his foot last year & being diagnosed with brittle bones. Although it is very lovely to have this tree it is now becoming a health hazard. There are many trees on the Avenue but not the same as this one. This morning a road sweeping vehicle cleared our road but left today’s fell of apples on the pavement as shown in the attached photos & even threw some up into the air. Shortly after I began to clear them up again & two elderly neighbours from number 12 said they were very grateful as the husband had recently slipt on them. I understand your policy specifies you do not deem fallen fruit as a hazard but in light of the potential hazard & excessive creaking I will be most grateful if the tree will be checked by one of your experts & hopefully removed & replaced with a non fruiting true like the other trees in the avenue. I thank you in anticipation of an early reply.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Garden Avenue, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Council dumping bags of leaves, 25th September
item.description:

item.title: Bushes need dealing with, 25th September
item.description:
The footpath that runs along sandy Lane, beside the golf course is very overgrown. (The one that starts just after golf course entrance to just before gym entrance) It would be ideal if bushes are cut back and opened up a bit to let more light in. Ideal time to do it while no traffic is going down lane.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sandy Lane, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More illegal red cross vandalism on pedestrian crossing, 25th September
item.description:
There has been more new offensive 'red cross' graffiti vandalism on the zebra crossing. Despite the old graffiti being painted over, new graffiti has appeared. Suggest that the crossing is replaced with a 'Rainbow' pedestrian crossing for inclusivity!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lauriston Road, Hackney, London
